intro: Dicliptera tetrandra, commonly known as the four-thread grass, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typically clustered at the base of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along water bodies. Dicliptera tetrandra is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in landscaping due to its fine texture and ability to form dense turf.
